Class SimulationRunner

java.lang.Object
iot.SimulationRunner
public class SimulationRunner
extends java.lang.Object
Class used for running a simulation

Marlon Saelens

    void resultRunBoxPlot​(int amountRuns, java.util.List<Pair<java.lang.Integer,​java.lang.Integer>> configurationList)
    Function for gathering information for multiple runs for some specific parameters used for visualising them via a boxplot This is used to visualise the diversity of the values for air quality and number of adaptations for a certain amount of runs with noise added
    void resultRunBoxPlot2​(int amountRuns, java.util.List<Pair<java.lang.Integer,​java.lang.Integer>> configurationList)
    Function for gathering information for multiple runs for some specific parameters used for visualising them via a boxplot This is used for visualising the diversity of effective values for the air quality for an amount of runs and the averages of all predicted values for the air quality for the whole run for a certain amount of runs and added noise
    void resultRunBoxPlot3​(int amountRuns, java.util.List<Pair<java.lang.Integer,​java.lang.Integer>> configurationList)
    Function for gathering information for multiple runs for some specific parameters used for visualising them via a boxplot This method is used for visualising the diversity of the average difference of the predicted cost of the next connection to take by the mote calculated by the routing application and the effective cost of that connection calculated by the route-evaluator for a certain amount of runs

    • setupSingleRun

      public void setupSingleRun​(boolean startFresh)
      Set the simulator up for a single (regular) run.
      Parameters:
      startFresh - If true: reset the history stored in the Statistics class.

    • multipleRun

      public void multipleRun​(MutableInteger updateFrequency, SimulationUpdateListener listener)
      Function for doing multiple runs after each other for getting a result about the average time and worste time of doing a decision wether or not change the path
      Parameters:
      updateFrequency - the frequency to visually update the path
      listener - listener used to update the visibility of the mote

    • resultRun

      public void resultRun​(int minimumBufferSizeHeight, int maximumBufferSizeHeight, int minimumBufferSizeWidth, int maximumBufferSizeWidth)
      Function used for getting data for plotting a graphic to show the relationship between the parameters of the adaptation method and the air quality/number of adaptations
      Parameters:
      minimumBufferSizeHeight - buffersize height to start the iteration
      maximumBufferSizeHeight - buffersize height to stop the iteration
      minimumBufferSizeWidth - buffersize width to start the iteration
      maximumBufferSizeWidth - buffersiz width to end the iteration For example minHeight:1,maxHeight2,minWidth:1,maxWidth:2, will gather information for height 1 width 1, height 1 width 2, height 2 width 1 and height 2 width 2

    • visualiseRun

      public void visualiseRun​(int bufferSizeWidth, int bufferSizeHeight)
      Function to gather information for visualising the utility of using an adpation method for following the best path for one run with specific parameters
      Parameters:
      bufferSizeWidth - buffersize Width used in the simulation
      bufferSizeHeight - buffersize height used in the simulation

    • resultRunBoxPlot

      public void resultRunBoxPlot​(int amountRuns, java.util.List<Pair<java.lang.Integer,​java.lang.Integer>> configurationList)
      Function for gathering information for multiple runs for some specific parameters used for visualising them via a boxplot This is used to visualise the diversity of the values for air quality and number of adaptations for a certain amount of runs with noise added
      Parameters:
      amountRuns - the amount of runs per parameter selection
      configurationList - the list of parameters to gather the information from

    • resultRunBoxPlot2

      public void resultRunBoxPlot2​(int amountRuns, java.util.List<Pair<java.lang.Integer,​java.lang.Integer>> configurationList)
      Function for gathering information for multiple runs for some specific parameters used for visualising them via a boxplot This is used for visualising the diversity of effective values for the air quality for an amount of runs and the averages of all predicted values for the air quality for the whole run for a certain amount of runs and added noise
      Parameters:
      amountRuns - the amount of runs per parameter selection
      configurationList - the list of parameters to gather the information from

    • resultRunBoxPlot3

      public void resultRunBoxPlot3​(int amountRuns, java.util.List<Pair<java.lang.Integer,​java.lang.Integer>> configurationList)
      Function for gathering information for multiple runs for some specific parameters used for visualising them via a boxplot This method is used for visualising the diversity of the average difference of the predicted cost of the next connection to take by the mote calculated by the routing application and the effective cost of that connection calculated by the route-evaluator for a certain amount of runs
      Parameters:
      amountRuns - the amount of runs per parameter selection
      configurationList - the list of parameters to gather the information from

    • multipleRun

      public void multipleRun​(java.util.HashMap<Mote,​Pair<java.lang.Long,​java.lang.Long>> time, java.util.HashMap<Mote,​Pair<java.lang.Double,​java.lang.Integer>> result)
      Function used for initialising the next run in the multiple run option
      Parameters:
      time - timeresults of the earlier runs
      result - results about air-quality and amount of adaptations to show if we have done a certain amount of runs. These results have not to be updated because the air quality for multiple runs without noise is almost the same. For doing multiple runs with noise, there is an experimental option to do multiple runs after each other and visualise the results by a boxplot, see method resultRunBoxPlot

    • setupMultipleRun

      public void setupMultipleRun​(boolean startFresh)
      Set the simulator up for MultipleRun
      Parameters:
      startFresh - If true: reset the history stored in the Statistics class.

      public void simulateCalculatedRunForResult()
      Simulate a whole run, until the simulation is finished. Result of the run is not visible

    • simulateVisualiseRun

      public void simulateVisualiseRun()
      Simulate a whole run, until the simulation is finished. Result of the run is not visible Used for making the utility of adaptation visible

    • simulateVisualiseRun2

      public void simulateVisualiseRun2()
      Simulate a whole run, until the simulation is finished. Result of the run is not visible Used for making the utility of adaptation visible

    • simulateCalculatedRun

      public void simulateCalculatedRun​(MutableInteger updateFrequency, SimulationUpdateListener listener)
      Simulate a whole run, until the simulation is finished.
      Parameters:
      updateFrequency - The frequency of callback updates to the listener (expressed in once every x simulation steps).
      listener - The listener which receives the callbacks every x simulation steps.
